comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: What a  lot of red cars!

comment.author: 7945368@N05
comment._content: For once, I can indentify some of the cars here!

comment.author: 7945368@N05
comment._content: I can see 3 Austin Montegos, 4 Vauxhall Novas, an Astramax van, 2 Ford Escorts (one might be an XR3i), a Renault Traffic van, an RUC Tangi Landrover, a Ford Sierra, a Toyota Litace, a Mitsubishi Colt, a C Class Mercedes, I think the nose of an Austin Mini Mastro,  a Transit van, a Renault 5, a Renault 4 van, a Suzuki Swift, 2 Fiat Pandas and a Nissan Bluebird.  The dark grey tail on the right foreground might be a Ford Cortina.  The blue car behind the Transit van might be a Peugeot estate.  The red car behind the Astramax van might be a Ford Sierra (face lift version, so newer than the one on the other side of the road.  The blue car parked in the middle 3rd along might be a 4th Montego.  The car being twoed by the recovery truck looks to be an old mercedes.  The green car in the foreground I think is a Triumph.

comment.author: 7945368@N05
comment._content: Nearly sure it's a Liteace, not a Hiace. Liteace - www.flickr.com/photos/55720630@N06/7099857393/ Hiace - www.flickr.com/photos/46637666@N07/6689775637/

comment.author: 7945368@N05
comment._content: Wikipedia RUC Landrover entry - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Land_Rover_Tangi

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/joefuz] Crikey, you've been storing up that car identification extravaganza! Thanks a million - tagging up a storm from your comment. And brilliant spotting of the Irwin's Bakery Truck!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: And thanks to all the rest of you for putting notes on the various vehicles, and for being gentlemanly about the great 2012 Liteace vs. Hiace controversy!  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/joefuz] The Mercedes C-class wasn't introduced until 1993, so that one you see is a Mercedes Benz 190E.

The older Mercedes being towed away looks like a W116, the S-class of it's day.

comment.author: 7945368@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] 190E works for me!

comment.author: 7945368@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] All my car knowledge is of recent stuff.  Not so good with older models.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/joefuz] Thanks, I had been hedging my bets just with Mercedes, but Mercedes Benz 190E it is! When did people stop adding Benz anyway? Or is it not Benz anymore?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] It's still Mercedes-Benz, or Daimler-Benz to be precise I guess.
And Benz should really get a mention. Karl Benz was there at the start.

comment._content: The Mercedes W116 being towed away is a Mercedes Bends.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Beware Geeks Sharing Suzuki Swifts . . . !

 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/10047629@N04] What is the bottom left car?  And the one above? 

And why was RED so fashionable in 1990 Lurgan?

comment.author: 64555638@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] The Red <del>Hand</del> Car of Ulster.

I think the bottom left red car is either an early Fiesta, or a VW Polo.

comment.author: 10047629@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/eyelightfilms] It's a 1981-1983 first generation Ford Fiesta - the large bumpers arrived in late 1981, and the wrap around headlights replaced this earlier style in 1983.

The Triumph Acclaim and facelift Sierra in the bottom left corner were already id'd by Joefuz. Nothing to add there.

comment.author: 45282459@N02
comment._content: Your choices for all cars are red or grey tones... That is all.
